original_solution_mapping.L1: The difference in width between where they're starting from and their destination is 80-50 = <<80-50=30>>30 yards
original_solution_mapping.L2: The width increases 2 yards every 10 m along the river so they would have to cover (30/2)*10 = <<(30/2)*10=150>>150 meters
original_solution_mapping.L3: Traveling at the rate of 5m/s, he will spend 150/5 = <<150/5=30>>30 seconds

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1671.
    Returns: the time it takes to get to the point where the river is 80 yards wide.
    """
    # L1
    destination_width = 80 # river is 80 yards wide
    starting_width = 50 # river that is 50 yards wide at one end
    width_difference = destination_width - starting_width

    # L2
    width_increase_per_distance = 2 # increases from this end uniformly by 2 yards every 10 meters
    distance_for_increase = 10 # increases from this end uniformly by 2 yards every 10 meters
    distance_to_cover = (width_difference / width_increase_per_distance) * distance_for_increase

    # L3
    travel_rate = 5 # row along the river at a rate of 5 m/s
    time_taken = distance_to_cover / travel_rate

    # FA
    answer = time_taken
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The difference in width between where they're starting from and their destination is {destination_width}-{starting_width} = <<{destination_width}-{starting_width}={width_difference}>>{width_difference} yards

The width increases {width_increase_per_distance} yards every {distance_for_increase} m along the river so they would have to cover ({width_difference}/{width_increase_per_distance})*{distance_for_increase} = <<({width_difference}/{width_increase_per_distance})*{distance_for_increase}={distance_to_cover}>>{distance_to_cover} meters
Traveling at the rate of {travel_rate}m/s, he will spend {distance_to_cover}/{travel_rate} = <<{distance_to_cover}/{travel_rate}={time_taken}>>{time_taken} seconds
